Devs can't take criticisim and gives their main supporters the sort end of the stick, due to recent events I will be uninstalling this game finally although it would only be fair for me to speak my mind. The lack of real innovative ideas and updates to possibly make this game any bit enjoyable have been slim to none. Glitches are never fixed these "updates" have become truly meaningless, the queue time in games are absurdly long and the game aesthetically looks simply terrible 0/10 would not recommend to anyone

I would recommend this game to friends. Is fun and enjoyable when you have a full party. I only have one dis-like of this game. The killer's hit box is busted. You can vault over a wall, and the killer can still hit you, even though you are on the other side. They can also change their hit direction mid swing, which to be honest, just makes it difficult to pull off dodges on their attacks. Especially when they make a full 180 mid swing.

Dead by Daylight is one of the more addicting games I have played. I love how the progression mechanics work and how diverse the characters/cosmetics are. Beware though when buying this game, it's half lobby simulator and half actual game-play. Events are fun, I do recommend, but have plenty of time to wait for a lobby.

Infelizmente é um jogo que requer trabalho em equipe e isso acontece em 1 a cada 20 a 30 que você joga, em uma partida o time se ajuda e ta tudo bem, no outro é literalmente cada um por si e tudo da errado, então eu só recomendaria esse jogo se você tiver com um time fechado de amigos, caso seja um lobo solitário igual eu, não recomendo.

I enjoyed this game, for a while. Things changed, the game did not get better. 

There are several issues that players with many more hours than I have will address, and likely already have in videos on YouTube. The developer Q&A in late January left much to be desired from the developers. They have more of an attitude to ignore existing concerns they are well aware of, and instead seem to verbalize their lack the understanding of what makes their own game fun. 

Rather than accept the criticism, internalize it, and make the game BETTER, they resort to petty retaliation at the players who voice their criticism. Revoking the cosmetic items from the account of one of these voices under the lie of "harassing a member of the development team" is nothing shy of blatant pettiness. Without criticism, these developers have no idea of what changes will keep this game alive, or push the rest of the dwindling playerbase to VHS and alternatives yet to come.

Frankly, the developers' lack of understanding of their own game is a big concern for the future of this game. Notably, their attitude towards their latest MMR system and not knowing what is actually skillful in their own game, and thus deserving of an increase in ranking within the Skill-Based-Match-Making system. High rank means nothing. The high rank is full of sweaty competitive teams, cheaters, new players who manage to survive every game by avoiding the killer entirely but couldn't help the team to save their life, and the best players. But chances are you get matched with cheaters and/or new players against a killer with 6000 hours. There is no real incentive to climb the ranks, yet you do anyways because you never lose ranking, only gain. With enough games, everyone reaches high ranking, only to have more difficult games that absorb your entire focus yet provide less fun.

A lot of changes need to happen, to the game and the developers' attitude. Sadly, it just feels like this game I once enjoyed has fallen due to some complacency and cockiness. Ignoring the repeated concerns voiced by the community and waving it away with lies or some goofy explanation that reflects a glaring misunderstanding of the game, is not the way for this game to evolve or even maintain the playerbase. 

I for one, am uninstalling. 
Not because I dislike the game, or don't enjoy it. Not because I side with one influencer or another. Not because I hate BHVR or any of the independent developers that staff it.
Simply because I do not like the direction this game is heading. I played to have fun, and I'm not having fun with this game in its current state. Ignoring important changes that would make this game fun again is unfortunately a common occurrence. A massive concern for me is the developers' paper-thin skin, getting defensive and hostile towards its players rather than internalizing the criticisms that could make this game great. If I ever wanted to stream DbD on my own channel, the hostility against criticism has convinced me I'm better off steering clear, lest I attract their wrath and they delete all of my dlcs and cosmetics from my account.

I'd like to recommend this game. 
It can be fun. There's a lot of shit it has going for it, too. The gameplay is simple, easy to understand, but has a lot of ways to master neat tricks and skills. There's a ton of builds you're able to do, and many of them are real interesting and creative.

However, I can't.
All those unique builds and awesome tricks are less useful than just doing what's best. No need to learn awesome techs as survivor when "Shift - W" works better against 90% of killers. The game isn't unbalanced, but the balance is made in an incredibly un-fun way, of the best strategies from either side being boring and lame at the highest tier.

This is not a new problem, but it's becoming increasingly clear they have no intention of addressing it. Recent FAQs have shown clearly that the lead devs don't have a strong grasp of skill; according to their vision, facecamping three survivors is better than getting 9 hooks and have three escape. I don't want to punish a killer for camping if they have to camp, but I don't think anyone in their right mind think that camping and shift-W is the intended state of a PvP horror game.

This, coupled with their incredibly toxic and immature response to criticism, means that I have absolutely no faith in things to get better. For a long time, they HAVE been getting better. Despite a lot of critiques, Dead by Daylight was a much better game than when I first joined it. However, it seems like it's peaked way too early, because it's just sliding back down. No broken unbalanced matches; only boring ones, where if you want to succeed you have to play as little as possible.

I hope I have reason to delete this review soon, but.

I can see why the good devs that cared about theis game left the team because they didn't want to be part of this game when it goes down. So devs I hope that you get the sticks out from your asses and start putting effort into this game because you are failing it extremely and I'm gonna feel bad for the people in the future that get this game.

[h1]Here are what some of the most influential philosophers of all time think of this game:[/h1]
[i]“I loop therefore I am” – [b]René Descartes[/b]
“He who thinks great mind games, often makes great errors” – [b]Martin Heidegger[/b]
“The life of a killer main is solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short” – [b]Thomas Hobbes[/b]
“There is only one thing a survivor can be relied upon to do, and that is to contradict other survivors” – [b]William James[/b]
“The entity is dead! He remains dead! And we have killed him” – [b]Friedrich Nietzsche[/b]
“There is only one good, bloodpoints, and one evil, Behaviour” – [b]Socrates[/b]
“The greater the SWF, the more glory in surmounting it” – [b]Epicurus[/b]
“This is patently absurd; but whoever wishes to become a killer main must learn not to be frightened by absurdities” – [b]Bertrand Russell[/b]
“Iridescent shards are the highest good” – [b]Aristotle[/b]
“In the end… We only regret the chances we did take” – [b]Lewis Carroll[/b]
“I don’t know why we are here, but I’m pretty sure it is not in order to enjoy ourselves” – [b]Ludwig Wittgenstein[/b]
“Kills and escapes, hooks and gens, are the only motives to a rational creature” – [b]John Locke[/b]
“Dropping your item is not the doctrine of how we may get ourselves hatch, but of how we may make ourselves worthy of hatch” – [b]Immanuel Kant[/b]
“The function of complaining is not to influence Behaviour, but rather to change the nature of the one who complains” – [b]Søren Kierkegaard[/b]
“If running the killer for 5 gens doesn't get you the win, was it really a skilled play in the first place?” – [b]Patrick Harris[/b]
“That man is wisest who, like Patrick, realizes that his looping is worthless” – [b]Plato[/b]
“Players have hitherto only interpreted the game in various ways; the point, however, is to change it” – [b]Karl Marx[/b]
“I like this game and could willingly waste my time in it” – [b]William Shakespeare[/b]
“A little looping inclineth man's mind to pallet camping; but depth in looping bringeth men’s minds about to trees” – [b]Sir Francis Bacon[/b]
“All that is necessary for the triumph of basement bubba is that survivors try to unhook” – [spoiler]mistakenly attributed to[/spoiler] [b]Edmund Burke[/b]
“Don't hate the player hate the game” – [b]Ice T[/b]
“Twins mains hate themselves” – [b]not Otzdarva[/b][/i]
